title: A "Cultural Awareness And Diversity" Teacher Resigns After Accused Of Writing Slur Near Student's Seating Chart Photo
description:
A California teacher at Sierra Middle School resigned after being accused of writing the N-word next to a Black student’s picture on a seating chart.

Students informed parents and officials that they saw the N-word in quotations beside their classmate’s picture. The educator was identified as Kelly Nordstrom, a cultural awareness and diversity teacher.

— (@)

In yet another attempt from the left to advance equity, the largest and most progressive hospital system in Georgia has replaced Christmas Eve from its paid holiday calendar and replaced it with Juneteenth, effective next year.

title: Paratrooper chugs beer as he plummets to Earth, and you'll relate to his two words describing what drives him to drink
description:
VOTE IN THE LWC 2024 GOP STRAW POLL! CLICK HERE!

There are few things I enjoy more than day drinking. It's why God invented beer. Or flavored seltzer, if your only other option is an IPA. But while I am crushing beers during the sunlight hours, it's from the safety of a front porch rocking chair. A Canadian paratrooper is going viral for throwing one back as he was in the middle of paratrooping.

Really. Cracking open a Miller Lite while his chute was deployed and he was plummeting to Earth.

— (@)

What drives our hero to drink?<

title: Kristi Noem expected to endorse Donald Trump At South Dakota Rally As Vice-President Rumors Heat Up
description:
VOTE IN THE LWC 2024 GOP STRAW POLL! CLICK HERE!

Former President Trump is set to headline a rally in South Dakota Friday alongside Gov. Kristi Noem, fueling speculation that the Gov. will be trading in views of Mount Rushmore for a home at the Naval Observatory.

“Oh, absolutely,” Noem said during an interview with Newsmax when asked whether she would consider a theoretical opportunity to be Trump’s running mate.

title: Power Rankings: Where do the GOP candidates stand right now?
description:
VOTE IN THE LWC 2024 GOP STRAW POLL! CLICK HERE!

Now that we have had a few weeks after the first Republican debate, here is a look at where I think the GOP primary stands right now. The plan is to do this after each debate, depending on whether I think there has been any movement.

Quick disclaimers:

- I've already, personally, declared myself all-in for one of the candidates.

- I will support whoever is the nominee against Joe Biden. Or Kamala Harris. Or Gavin Newsom.

- My view of polls is that they should all be taken with a grain of salt. There are too many of them, and they are rapidly turning into clickbait both for the pollster and the candidates. For example: how many people on X
